newsitem.title: IRAQ: U.S. strike kills one person injures seven - INA. [CORRECTED 12:05 GMT]
newsitem.headline: U.S. strike kills one person injures seven - INA. [CORRECTED 12:05 GMT]

text.p: Iraq said U.S. cruise missiles launched against it on Wednesday killed one person and injured seven, the Iraqi News Agency (INA) said.
INA, quoting a statement by Iraq's General Command of the Armed Forces, said Iraq's air defences shot down "the bulk" of the missiles fired at targets in southern Iraq.
The Iraqi command lambasted President Bill Clinton for ordering the attack, the second in two days.
"The criminal Clinton, on his way to fall into the bottom of vice ... added more crimes to his history which is full with evil and crime.

"The rancorous American enemy at 5:35 a.m. (0135 GMT) (corrects GMT from 0935) on September 4, 1996 fired 17 cruise missiles against some military sites and residential quarters of civilians," the statement said.
